title: Calingasta Department
text:
Calingasta is a department of the province of <a href="San%20Juan%20Province%20%28Argentina%29">San Juan</a> (<a href="Argentina">Argentina</a>). It is the southwestern corner of the province, which is predominantly a landscape of <a href="mountains">mountains</a> and rivers. It is characterized by its production of <a href="apple">apple</a>s and by tourism, mainly in the tourist towns of Barreal and <a href="Tamber%C3%ADas">Tamberías</a>
Origin of name.
Several meanings that have been given to indigenous root of this word. People of the inhabitants of Calían. Skirt or safe or major hills. Transforming Catalve "(River of the hillside), as the area was called Calingasta prior to the arrival of the Spaniards.
Geography.
The department Calingasta comprises the southwest corner of the province of San Juan. It is west of the <a href="San%20Juan%2C%20Argentina">City of San Juan</a> with an area of . Its boundaries are:
Relief.
Calingasta has a rugged, hilly topography due to its location is at the foot of the Andes. The mountain <a href="Mercedario">Mercedario</a> is the eighth-highest mountain of the Andes with an altitude of . It is located north of <a href="Aconcagua">Aconcagua</a>. It is possible to highlight an area precordillerana lower height as the first with numerous mountain cave highlight the <a href="Sierra%20del%20Tontal">Sierra del Tontal</a>. The soil is mainly desert with little vegetation cover except on the river banks in the valleys.
Climate.
The climate is mostly desert with little precipitation, highlighting marked thermal amplitudes, with notable differences in temperature between night and day, a major solar radiation.
